title: XR-Based Immersive Mathematics Practice: Enhancing Problem-Solving Skills Through Microlearning

context.prior_knowledge: Middle School-Level Mathematics Fundamentals (Equations, Geometry, Functions)
context.additional_context: Building accessibility-focused XR learning environments using smartphones, with emphasis on work-integrated math practice.

learning_goals: Learners can solve 3D spatial geometry problems in XR environments with ≥85% accuracy
Mobile-based microlearning modules: 15-minute sessions, 5 times weekly

Within one week, learners will select two real-world business scenarios (budget calculation, data visualization) and submit results with 90% accuracy in budget calculations and the use of at least three chart types in data visualization, following a given project template.
Share problem-solving processes and provide feedback using collaborative XR tools with peers

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
